uk.co.strangeskies.modabi.processing

Interface BindingBlock

  • All Superinterfaces:
    uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable<BindingBlockEvent>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BindingBlockImpl

    public interface BindingBlock
extends uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable<BindingBlockEvent>
    A BindingBlock is intended to represent that a binding thread is waiting for resources or dependencies to be made available by some external or internal process.

    Each conceptual block should belong to a unique resource, and be given a unique namespace() and id().

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable

        uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable.TerminatingObserver<M>, uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable.WeakObserver<M,O>

    • Method Detail

      • namespace

        QualifiedName namespace()
        Returns:
        The namespace of the blocking resource

      • id

        DataSource id()
        Returns:
        The id of the blocking resource

      • isEnded

        boolean isEnded()
        Returns:
        True if the resource or dependency represented by this block is satisfied or failed, false otherwise

      • isSuccessful

        boolean isSuccessful()
        Returns:
        True if the resource or dependency represented by this block has completed, and was successful, false otherwise

      • getFailure

        Throwable getFailure()
        Returns:
        If the block has failed, the exception cause

      • isInternal

        boolean isInternal()
        Returns:
        True if the resource or dependency should be satisfied by processes internal to the binding procedure, false otherwise

      • complete

        void complete()
        Signal that the resource or dependency represented by this block has become available

      • waitUntilComplete

        void waitUntilComplete()
                throws InterruptedException,
                       ExecutionException
        Wait for availability of the resource or dependency.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the waiting thread is interrupted
        ExecutionException - If the block has been notified of failure via fail(Throwable)

      • waitUntilComplete

        void waitUntilComplete(long timeoutMilliseconds)
                throws InterruptedException,
                       TimeoutException,
                       ExecutionException
        Wait for availability of the resource or dependency, or throw an exception if the block does not complete within the given time.
        Parameters:
        timeoutMilliseconds - The amount of time to wait for completion
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the waiting thread is interrupted
        TimeoutException - If the block is not satisfied within the given time
        ExecutionException - If the block has been notified of failure via fail(Throwable)

      • fail

        boolean fail(Throwable cause)
        Signal a failure in making the resource or dependency available. If successful then pending and subsequent invocations of waitUntilComplete() will rethrow the given error. The failure will be ignored if the block has already completed successfully.
        Parameters:
        cause - An exception detailing the cause of the failure to secure the dependency and lift the block
        Returns:
        True if the failure was successfully registered, false otherwise
